confession.seduction_context: Had been angry because asked to pay so many debts; left house towards dawn; husband was away working on ramparts at Lunéville; roof of house had collapsed and she had to find him to get money; he gave her so little she did not know how to pay workmen
sabbat_activities: resolution taken to destroy the acorns

witnesses.name: Barbelline femme Colas Goudot
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Sebille was often in their house

testimony.quarrel_subject: husband quarrelled with Jean Pierson (accused's husband, who was herdsman)
accused charged with stealing plums from his tree
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il n'en avoit encore assé (he had not yet had enough)

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: illness lasting 5 or 6 years, died 12 years before testimony

testimony.quarrel_subject: refused to visit him when ill unless he reduced price of work by 2 or 3 gros

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 7 or 8 years before testimony, suddenly became ill when working on her chimney
3 weeks after refusing to sell straw; illness followed apple given at veillée, death a week later
12 or 13 years before, a year after brother's marriage
within a few weeks after child's death

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused told him he was cutting more hay than was his by right
testimony.threat_quote: de par dieu, il vault mieulx qu'elle soit morte que toy, ou ton mary, ou l'un de vos chevaulx (by God, it is better that she [the cow] is dead than you, or your husband, or one of your horses)

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: at same time as cart breaking; died next day after Sebille was called to see it

testimony.quarrel_subject: debt collection of 20 francs Jean Pierson owed to shepherd of Reillon; witness called her witch while drinking
testimony.threat_quote: she would never forget the insult

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: fell ill same day as quarrel; recovered

testimony.quarrel_subject: death of cow when her husband was herdsman; witness threatened to seek compensation
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il y en mourrait bien d'aultres (that many others would die)

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: sickened and died after the threat

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused of stealing plums and wood for a fire to dry them

harms_alleged.target: many pigs, a cow, and 2 horses
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 5 or 6 weeks after he called her witch and said she had caused Jean du Chesnoy's death

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute with Jean Pierson (accused's husband, his uncle) about putting a cow to milk

timeline.subject: Sebille femme Jean Pierson
timeline.details: Arrested after denunciation by Jenotte veuve Claudon Thoussainct

timeline.subject: Sebille femme Jean Pierson
timeline.details: First interrogation; had confessed to prévôt that she was a witch; described seduction 4 years before and sabbat attendance

timeline.subject: Sebille femme Jean Pierson
timeline.details: Second interrogation; provided biographical details and defended herself against charges

timeline.subject: Sebille femme Jean Pierson
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; after confrontations began confessing to acts of malefice

timeline.subject: Sebille femme Jean Pierson
timeline.details: Procureur Fiscal asks for torture to obtain more information

timeline.subject: Sebille femme Jean Pierson
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; suffered greatly on strappado; continued previous admissions, identified accomplices

timeline.subject: Sebille femme Jean Pierson
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Sebille femme Jean Pierson
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

timeline.subject: Sebille femme Jean Pierson
timeline.details: Execution carried out; maintained charges against those she had accused, even at stake

timeline.subject: Four denounced by Sebille
timeline.details: Following execution of first 2 witches, procureur fiscal issued general instruction for proceedings against four denounced by Sebille

accomplices_named.name: la Jobarde
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; procureur fiscal concerned about her use of dog's head to cure animals superstitiously

prior_accusations.context: Denunciation led to arrest on 9 February 1602

notable_quotes.speaker: Sebille femme Jean Pierson
notable_quotes.french: a quoy elle respondit en soymesme qu'il ne la batteroit plus guiere, car elle avoit tant de repentance de son faict, et retourneroit de telle façon envers son dieu que tel malheur n'auroit plus de puissance sur elle
notable_quotes.english: to which she responded to herself that he would not beat her much longer, for she had such repentance for her deed, and would return in such a way to her God that such misfortune would have no more power over her
notable_quotes.context: Devil threatening to beat her to make her go to sabbat

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehennon veuve Jean de Chasnoy (quoting Sebille)
notable_quotes.english: that he had not yet had enough
notable_quotes.context: Sebille's response when Jean du Chasnoy accused her of giving him illness 2 or 3 years before his death

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Vaultrin (quoting Sebille)
notable_quotes.french: de par dieu, il vault mieulx qu'elle soit morte que toy, ou ton mary, ou l'un de vos chevaulx
notable_quotes.english: by God, it is better that she [the cow] is dead than you, or your husband, or one of your horses
notable_quotes.context: Sebille's response when told of cow's death

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Simon (quoting Sebille)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il y en mourrait bien d'aultres
notable_quotes.context: Sebille's response when Nicolas threatened to seek compensation for cow's death

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon veuve Claudon Jacquemin (quoting Sebille)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle estoit bonne pour la mettre a la Lonotte estimant par telles parolles persuader que leurs infortunes arrivoient par le moyen de ladite Jacquenatte
notable_quotes.english: that she [la Jacquenatte] was good to put at la Lonotte, estimating by such words to persuade that their misfortunes came through said Jacquenatte
notable_quotes.context: Sebille trying to deflect blame to la Jacquenatte

notable_quotes.speaker: Procureur Fiscal
notable_quotes.french: Et comme ledit Procureur est adverty particulierement que ladicte Jobarde auroit cy devant usé fort superstitieusement d'une teste de chien a guerir plusieurs bestiaulx et meme en presenté une a benir au Sr Curé dudit Leintrey et depuis a son Vicaire presentement Curé d'Embermesnil: pour soub la voile et couleur de piété user d'icelle envers le simple peuple et en commetre plusieurs abus, comme elle a faict: et que ce ne peult avoir esté faict sans presomption grande de quelque pact malin qui ne doit demeurer impuni
notable_quotes.english: And as said Procureur is particularly advised that said Jobarde had previously used very superstitiously a dog's head to cure several animals and even presented one to be blessed by the Lord Curé of said Leintrey and since to his Vicar presently Curé of Embermesnil: to under the veil and color of piety use it towards the simple people and commit several abuses, as she has done: and that this cannot have been done without great presumption of some malign pact which must not remain unpunished
notable_quotes.context: Procureur fiscal's instructions for proceedings against la Jobarde, expressing concern about superstitious practices

relationships.evidence_text: daughter of late Demenge Poirot, laboureur
daughter of late Demenge Poirot, laboureur, and his wife Jehenne

economic_context.details: Sebille's seduction by devil occurred during financial crisis: asked to pay many debts, roof of house had collapsed, husband away working on ramparts at Lunéville, he gave her so little money she did not know how to pay workmen. Jean Pierson owed 20 francs to shepherd of Reillon. Quarrels over: refusing to reduce price of chimney work, refusing to sell straw, boundaries between gardens, accusations of stealing plums and wood. Jean Pierson worked as herdsman. Witness Demenge Michiel Ballance paid Sebille for chimney work.

harms_catalog.harm_description: drowned in horsepond behind Sebille's house

harms_catalog.victim_name: animals of Jennon veuve Claudon Jacquemin
harms_catalog.harm_description: many losses especially just after marriage 20 years earlier
started to vomit and was ill for a week

husband quarrelled with husband of accused (herdsman)

harms_catalog.method_alleged: gave him herbs to put on arms (also cured him)

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, then worse after Sebille waved arm over her, died a week later
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 3 weeks before; later came to veillée
harms_catalog.method_alleged: gave an apple; later 'tournoyer son bras sur ladite fille'

harms_catalog.harm_description: both died within a few weeks

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: told him he was cutting more hay than was his by right

harms_catalog.harm_description: became sick, died next day after Sebille was called to see it

death of cow when her husband was herdsman; witness threatened compensation
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after her threat 'many others would die'

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost many pigs, a cow, and 2 horses

dispute with her late husband about putting a cow to milk
housekeeper refused her bread as alms

material_culture.context: Sebille gave pear to Nicolas (Barbelline's son); he became ill
Sebille gave apple to Thoussaince at veillée; child became ill and died
Sebille gave herbs to Demenge Michiel Ballance to put on arms to cure illness
Admitted being given powder at sabbat, but had not used it

material_culture.object: images of St Nicolas and St Claude
material_culture.context: Sebille equipped herself with these images to avoid devil
Accused of stealing plums from Jean du Chesnoy's tree
Accused of stealing wood for a fire to dry plums
Didier Connot refused to sell Sebille straw
Nicolas Vaultrin's cart broke after quarrel with Sebille
Curé's housekeeper refused Sebille bread as alms
Debt Jean Pierson owed to shepherd of Reillon
Amount Demenge Michiel Ballance offered to reduce price of work
Devil's money was leaves as usual
La Jobarde used dog's head superstitiously to cure animals, had it blessed by curé

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; residence of accused and most witnesses
Where Sebille worked in service for 3 years before marriage
Home of le Petit Noel, seen at sabbat
Where Jean Pierson was working on ramparts when Sebille was seduced
Home of shepherd to whom Jean Pierson owed 20 francs
Where Jean Pierson was called before prévôt regarding debt
Estienne Connot had to go towards Dieuze
Home of girl Jean Bon Claude's son wanted to marry
Where vicar who blessed dog's head became curé
Where child of Jennon veuve Claudon Jacquemin drowned 17 years earlier
Place Sebille suggested la Jacquenatte should be put
Where Sebille saw accomplices; resolution taken to destroy acorns

historical_context.military_details: Husband was away working on ramparts at Lunéville during time of seduction
economic_hardship_indicators: Sebille's anger before seduction was because asked to pay so many debts
Husband gave her so little money she did not know how to pay workmen
Too poor to take Jean du Chesnoy to law
Husband 'n'est point de deffence' (not one to defend)
Jean Pierson owed 20 francs to shepherd
Sebille refused bread as alms from curé's housekeeper
religious_calendar_references: feast-day when child drowned in horsepond

prior_legal_disputes.description: Jean du Chesnoy charged Sebille with stealing plums from his tree
Nicolas Jean Gerardin told she had stolen plums and wood for fire
Estienne Connot collected debt of 20 francs Jean Pierson owed to shepherd of Reillon; Jean Pierson called before prévôt at Blamont
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Jean Pierson made fruitless journey as shepherd failed to appear

legal_context.redress_outcome: Did not take Jean du Chesnoy to law for calling her witch because they were too poor and her husband 'n'est point de deffence'

emotional_state_notes: Initially started to say she was not a witch at all, then gave way
After confrontations, exhorted to think of her salvation, started to make series of confessions
Maintained charges against those she had accused, even at stake

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Child drowned on feast-day; Jennon should have been in church with child according to custom, rather than cooking at home
Jean du Chesnoy had done her wrong, and he was already ill when he came to Leintrey
If she gave him herbs this did not mean she was cause of illness, and he already had two kinds of them
Estienne Connot was drunk when he called her witch, as he often was
Denied telling Jennon that la Jacquenatte had said she was good to put at la Lonotte; tried to deflect blame to la Jacquenatte

third_parties.name: Jenotte veuve Claudon Thoussainct
third_parties.context: Denounced Sebille, leading to her arrest; seen at sabbat by Sebille

third_parties.name: la Jacquenatte
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: known to Jennon veuve Claudon Jacquemin
third_parties.context: Sebille allegedly tried to deflect blame to her, saying she was responsible for Jennon's misfortunes and was 'good to put at la Lonotte'

third_parties.name: Hillenix
third_parties.context: Sent twice by husband to ask Sebille to visit him when he was ill

third_parties.name: shepherd of Reillon
third_parties.context: Jean Pierson owed him 20 francs; Estienne Connot undertook to collect debt

third_parties.name: Jean Bon Claude
third_parties.context: Sebille claimed he had given illness to Jean du Chesnoy in hatred because du Chesnoy had prevented his son marrying a girl from Autrepierre

third_parties.name: housekeeper of curé
third_parties.context: Refused Sebille bread as alms; Sebille confessed to killing curé's cow in revenge

third_parties.name: Jean Pierson (brother of witness Demenge Pierson)
third_parties.context: Married, first child died a year later, then he and wife both died within a few weeks; suspected to be Sebille's witchcraft

third_parties.name: wife of Jean Pierson (brother)
third_parties.context: Died within few weeks of husband and child

third_parties.name: children of Estienne Connot
third_parties.context: Told father off for having anything to do with debt collection business in view of Sebille's reputation

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with 11 witnesses, extensive testimony about harms, quarrels, and threats. Rich documentation of economic hardship context around seduction. Notable quotes preserved in French with context. Sebille confessed under torture but also made voluntary confessions after confrontations. Named 6 accomplices at sabbat. Execution note indicates she was one of 'first 2 witches' executed, suggesting coordinated proceedings. Procureur fiscal's instructions about la Jobarde reveal concerns about superstitious practices using dog's head.
